definition: gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
to be scared out of one's wits

sentences.english: Downplay the scary, chilling, creepy, parts of Halloween.
sentences.chinese: 淡化萬聖節那可怕，令人膽寒生畏的部分。

sentences.english: Just the mention of foot-and-mouth leaves many British farmers with a chill.
sentences.chinese: 一說起口蹄疫，英國農場主們就膽寒。

sentences.english: Attila struck terror into the people of Eastern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 匈奴王阿提拉曾令東歐人民膽寒。

sentences.english: Mum said her blood ran cold and she dialed my number straight away.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽說她立馬心驚膽寒地撥打了我的電話。

definition: lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight/also written 觸目驚心|触目惊心
to slap the table in amazement (idiom); wonderful!/amazing!
to have no sense of shame/brazen
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
lit. bleak wind and icy rain (idiom)/fig. hardships/miserable circumstances
to walk right into the trap
